title: To Kill a Mockingbird
description: A novel set in the American South during the 1930s, addressing issues of racial injustice.
author: Harper Lee

title: The Hobbit
description: A fantasy novel about the journey of Bilbo Baggins, who embarks on an adventure to reclaim the treasure guarded by the dragon Smaug.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

title: The Count of Monte Cristo
description: An adventure novel about a young sailor named Edmond Dantès who is falsely accused and imprisoned, but later escapes to seek revenge.
author: Alexandre Dumas

title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
description: The first book in the Harry Potter series, following the journey of a young wizard, Harry Potter, as he attends Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.
author: J.K. Rowling

title: The Hunger Games
description: The first book in The Hunger Games trilogy, set in a dystopian world where teenagers fight to the death in a televised event.
author: Suzanne Collins

title: The Da Vinci Code
description: A mystery thriller novel that follows symbologist Robert Langdon as he investigates a murder in the Louvre Museum and discovers a hidden secret.
author: Dan Brown

title: The Lord of the Rings
description: A fantasy epic that follows the quest to destroy the One Ring and defeat the Dark Lord Sauron.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
description: A crime thriller novel that follows journalist Mikael Blomkvist and hacker Lisbeth Salander as they investigate a disappearance.
author: Stieg Larsson

title: The Chronicles of Narnia
description: A series of fantasy novels set in the fictional realm of Narnia, featuring various adventures and allegorical themes.
author: C.S. Lewis

title: Percy Jackson & the Olympians
description: A series of fantasy-adventure novels that follows the demigod Percy Jackson as he discovers his true identity and battles mythological creatures.
author: Rick Riordan

title: Sherlock Holmes
description: A collection of detective stories featuring the brilliant detective Sherlock Holmes and his loyal companion Dr. John Watson.
author: Arthur Conan Doyle

title: The Catcher in the Rye
description: A novel narrated by a teenager named Holden Caulfield, who describes his experiences in New York City after being expelled from prep school.
author: J.D. Salinger

title: The Kite Runner
description: A novel that follows the story of Amir, a young boy from Afghanistan, as he navigates friendship, betrayal, and redemption.
author: Khaled Hosseini

title: The Secret Garden
description: A children's novel that tells the story of Mary Lennox, a young girl who discovers a hidden garden on her uncle's estate.
author: Frances Hodgson Burnett

title: The Stand
description: A post-apocalyptic horror novel that follows the survivors of a global pandemic as they confront dark forces in a world decimated by disease.
author: Stephen King

title: The Road Less Traveled
description: A self-help book that explores love, growth, and spiritual growth, offering insights into the complexities of human relationships.
author: M. Scott Peck

title: Life of Pi
description: A novel that follows the story of Piscine Molitor Patel, a boy who survives a shipwreck and is stranded on a lifeboat in the Pacific Ocean with a Bengal tiger named Richard Parker.
author: Yann Martel

title: The Martian
description: A science fiction novel that follows astronaut Mark Watney, who is stranded on Mars and must use his ingenuity to survive until rescue.
author: Andy Weir

title: The Book Thief
description: A historical novel set in Nazi Germany, narrated by Death and following the story of a young girl named Liesel Meminger who steals books and shares them with others.
author: Markus Zusak

title: The Fault in Our Stars
description: A young adult romance novel that tells the story of Hazel Grace Lancaster, a sixteen-year-old cancer patient, who falls in love with Augustus Waters, a fellow cancer patient.
author: John Green

title: Gone Girl
description: A psychological thriller novel that follows the mysterious disappearance of Amy Dunne and the subsequent investigation, revealing secrets and lies in her marriage.
author: Gillian Flynn

title: The Shining
description: A horror novel that follows Jack Torrance, an aspiring writer and recovering alcoholic, who becomes the winter caretaker of the isolated and haunted Overlook Hotel.
author: Stephen King

title: Moby-Dick
description: A novel that tells the story of the obsessive quest of Captain Ahab for revenge on Moby Dick, a giant white sperm whale.
author: Herman Melville

title: The Odyssey
description: An ancient Greek epic poem attributed to Homer, chronicling the adventures of Odysseus during his journey home from the Trojan War.
author: Homer

title: The Brothers Grimm Fairy Tales
description: A collection of German fairy tales compiled by the Brothers Grimm, featuring stories like Cinderella, Snow White, and Hansel and Gretel.
author: Brothers Grimm

title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
description: A collection of detective stories featuring the famous detective Sherlock Holmes and his loyal friend Dr. John Watson.
author: Arthur Conan Doyle

title: Frankenstein
description: A Gothic novel that tells the story of Victor Frankenstein, a young scientist who creates a grotesque creature in an unorthodox scientific experiment.
author: Mary Shelley

title: Dracula
description: A Gothic horror novel that tells the story of Count Dracula's attempt to move from Transylvania to England so he may find new blood and spread the undead curse.
author: Bram Stoker

title: Anna Karenina
description: A novel that explores themes of love, infidelity, jealousy, and redemption through the tragic story of the aristocrat Anna Karenina.
author: Leo Tolstoy

title: War and Peace
description: A historical novel that chronicles the history of the French invasion of Russia and the impact of the Napoleonic era on Tsarist society.
author: Leo Tolstoy

title: Pride and Prejudice
description: A romantic novel that follows the emotional development of Elizabeth Bennet, as she deals with issues of manners, upbringing, morality, education, and marriage in the society of the landed gentry of early 19th-century England.
author: Jane Austen

title: Jane Eyre
description: A novel that follows the experiences of its eponymous character, including her growth to adulthood and her love for Mr. Rochester, the brooding master of Thornfield Hall.
author: Charlotte Brontë

title: Wuthering Heights
description: A novel that follows the intense and passionate love story between Catherine Earnshaw and Heathcliff, set in the Yorkshire moors.
author: Emily Brontë

title: Sense and Sensibility
description: A novel that follows the romantic relationships of Elinor and Marianne Dashwood, as they navigate the societal expectations and financial struggles of the early 19th century.
author: Jane Austen

title: The Secret Garden
description: A novel that follows Mary Lennox, a young girl who discovers a hidden, neglected garden on her uncle's estate, unlocking secrets of the past and transforming her own life.
author: Frances Hodgson Burnett

title: Little Women
description: A novel that follows the lives of four sisters—Meg, Jo, Beth, and Amy March—detailing their passage from childhood to womanhood.
author: Louisa May Alcott
